alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 15 at 8:53PM MDT until June 17 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry and unstable conditions will prevail across the area through at least Saturday. Between 6 and 12 hours of single digit relative humidity readings are expected in the Middle Rio Grande Valley with a few hours possible elsewhere. Gusty westerly winds are expected each afternoon and evening bringing several hours of critical fire weather conditions to much of central and west central New Mexico. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...The Red Flag Warning includes the West Central Mountains (Zone 105), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109), and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) Friday afternoon and evening and the Fire Weather Watch includes the same areas Saturday afternoon and evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West and southwest at 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph, except 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 across the Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) Saturday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 7 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
